Data: 2pm: Australia win the toss and bowl, they have made four changes to their XI. Shane Watson returns to the top of the order, as expected, with Usman Khawaja making way; James Faulkner, Josh Hazlewood and Agar all come in, replacing Nathan Coulter-Nile, Andrew Tye and Adam Zampa. South Africa welcome back Steyn in place of Kyle Abbott, while Farhaan B
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 2 runs good length outside off, de Villiers follows it - as he did in Durban - and this time guides a couple wide of third man
Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs lashed through point for four! Quicksilver hands from de Villiers, given a bit of width and he happily cracked it for the first boundary of the day
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run back of a length, moves across and whips a bottom-handed jab to mid-on
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run in the channel, de Villiers drops back and glides one more to third man
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run dug in at 134kph, rising outside off as de Kock plays an angled bat, checks a pull down into the leg side
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run length ball, straighter line and de Kock is off the mark with a dab through backward square leg
Hastings to de Kock, 1 run shortish on the hips, tucked away for one more
Hastings to de Villiers, no run length ball, angled in towards off stump, de Villiers defends to the on side

Hastings to de Villiers, SIX runs skips out and WHACK! Down the wicket and flashes across the line, everything coming together smoothly as de Villiers deposits Hastings on to the grass banks at deep midwicket

Hastings to de Villiers, no run banged in and de Villiers gets in a tangle trying to pull... did that come off the glove on its way through? Hastings and Nevill were pretty convinced but umpire Shaun George less so. Looks like it came straight off the forearm
Hastings to de Villiers, no run short outside off, goes back and swings hard on the cut, fails to connect

Hastings to de Villiers, OUT bowled him, no doubt this time! De Villiers plays on, there'll be no Wanderers mauling this week... Tight lines from Hastings and de Villiers was trying to force it off the back foot, got a thick inside edge into off stump
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run dug in short, de Kock tries to pull and gets hit on the shoulder
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 wide fired down the leg side
Hazlewood to de Kock, FOUR runs short ball from Hazlewood and this is crumped through midwicket on the pull for de Kock's first boundary
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run nicely bowled, cranking up the pace and the ball nibbles back past the inside edge
Hazlewood to de Kock, no run back of a length and hits de Kock on the body as he tries to work to leg
Hazlewood to de Kock, FOUR runs hoicked over midwicket for four more! This was a decent length ball from Hazlewood, no width on offer but de Kock manufactured an angle to hit to leg
Hazlewood to de Kock, 2 runs short ball, shovelled away through backward square leg and a good diving stop prevents four more
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run off the mark straight away, opening the face outside off
Hastings to de Kock, no run back of a length, de Kock knocks it back in the direction of the bowler
Hastings to de Kock, no run extra pace on this, 143kph from Hastings and it flies through past an airy swipe from de Kock
Hastings to de Kock, FOUR runs flipped around the corner, cute shot from de Kock, moving across and sending a length ball over short fine leg and away for four
Hastings to de Kock, no run misses again with a big ole yahoo down the ground
Hastings to de Kock, no run short outside off, de Kock again attempts to hit the cover off it, fails to connect. Hastings demanding respect
Marsh to du Plessis, no run 130kph nibbler on off stump, du Plessis taps it away
Marsh to du Plessis, no run gets in tight to the stumps, length ball pushed into the covers coming forwards
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs du Plessis steps to leg and tries to make room, ends up clearing cover with a leading edge as Marsh followed him... couple more to the total
Marsh to du Plessis, no run middle and off, du Plessis works it to mid-on but has to send his partner back
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs full and spanked! Du Plessis sashays out and drills aerially over extra cover, disappeared in a trice

Marsh to du Plessis, SIX runs length ball on leg stump... and it's been flicked into the crowd at deep square leg! Flamboyant stuff from Faf, a flamingo flick and it fair flew, well beyond the man standing on the rope - that rather spoiled an otherwise decent start from Marsh
Hazlewood to de Kock, FOUR runs skips out to hit Hazelwood off his length, clears mid-on and that'll bounce away
Hazlewood to de Kock, FOUR runs drags it a little shorter and this is hammered on the up over midwicket, back-to-back fours for Quinny

Hazlewood to de Kock, SIX runs oh my word! That's extraordinary... This time he targets the off side, opens up his body and launches an uppercut over the covers, it sails through the thin Highveld air several metres back into the crowd. Woof!
Hazlewood to de Kock, 1 run short ball at the body, nudged away to leg
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs drops back and cuts wide of third man for two
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs length ball outside off, du Plessis goes hard at it and gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg for a couple more
Maxwell to de Kock, no run round the wicket, pushed through on off stump, tapped away
Maxwell to de Kock, FOUR runs slightly short and de Kock crunches a pull through square leg, quickly into position to dispatch it for four
Maxwell to de Kock, FOUR runs goes again, too short and straight from Maxwell, rocks back and slams it to the deep square leg boundary
Maxwell to de Kock, no run floated up a bit slower, pushed into the off side
Maxwell to de Kock, no run tossed up outside off, goes back to cut but finds the fielder at backward point
Maxwell to de Kock, FOUR runs full on leg stump, de Kock gets down low to sweep, sends the ball skimming away wide of short fine leg - third four in the over
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run length outside off, du Plessis stays in the crease and swats through point
Faulkner to de Kock, no run slower ball, out the back of the hand and this deceives de Kock, who plays and misses
Faulkner to de Kock, no run length ball outside off, drops back and dabs to backward point... and Marsh's throw isn't far from catching out de Kock as he scrambled back to his crease
Faulkner to de Kock, 1 run another legbreak from Faulkner, steered through point to the sweeper
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run on the stumps and punched down the ground

Faulkner to de Kock, OUT bowled him, de Kock is chopped down! Looked like he played around a full toss but Faulkner is happy either way... It was full and straight, he tried to clip to leg and got an inside edge on to his stumps
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up on the stumps and worked through midwicket
Maxwell to Duminy, no run presses forward and taps into the off side
Maxwell to Duminy, 1 run angled in from round the wicket, Duminy goes back and flicks one through midwicket to get going
Maxwell to du Plessis, no run over the wicket, tapped back to the bowler
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run dobbly offbreak on the stumps, comes forward and punches down the ground
Maxwell to Duminy, 1 run goes deep in the crease and manufactures the angle to whip another single through midwicket
Faulkner to Duminy, no run over the wicket, good length on off, Duminy comes forward and pushes to mid-off

Faulkner to Duminy, no run stumps broken at both ends! But no one is out... Duminy's bobbly drive was somehow deflected on to the stumps at the non-striker's end by du Plessis, but he managed to get his bat in
Faulkner to Duminy, FOUR runs slower ball, Duminy picks it a marches out to drive regally over the top for four
Faulkner to Duminy, 2 runs flicked to leg, in the air... but just short of the diving Smith at midwicket, bounced in front of his fingertips and squeezed through for a couple
Faulkner to Duminy, no run good full bunger, Duminy has to dig it out
Faulkner to Duminy, no run goes back outside off and steers a length ball to backward point
Marsh to du Plessis, (no ball) sliding down the leg side, that'll be a wide... actually, Marsh has flicked the non-striker's bails off, so it's a no-ball

Marsh to du Plessis, SIX runs takes the pace off... and du Plessis then puts it all back on, whipping a wristy pull into the stands, really got hold of it, landed on an awning some way up at deep square leg
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs on the stumps, worked into the leg side and they come racing back for two
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run length ball on the stumps, Faf steps away and drives into the covers
Marsh to Duminy, no run another slower ball, tapped down into the covers
Marsh to Duminy, SIX runs short ball, Duminy latches on to it and carts a pull high and handsome, comfortably beyond the boundary at deep square leg - that's the SA 100 up in style

Marsh to Duminy, OUT similar ball, similar shot - but this time he picks out deep midwicket! Duminy hangs his head in frustration, it was a half-tracker there to be hit but he seemed to get it off the toe of the bat and it went straight and true to the man stationed on the fence
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run tossed up from round the wicket, Miller nurdles it away to leg
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run over the wicket, on the stumps, bobbled away to leg
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run switches back to round the wicket, worked off the legs for one more
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up outside off, du Plessis crouches to bunt through cover point

Maxwell to Miller, no run Miller walks down the pitch, attempts to play to leg again, the ball deflects off glove and pad, I think, and ends up going behind him... he has to dive back sharpish to prevent a smart stumping from Nevill
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run floated up on middle and leg, Miller comes forward and works one through mid-on to keep the strike
Agar to Miller, 1 run stately high arm from Agar, flighted outside off, chipped down the ground for one
Agar to du Plessis, 1 run drags his length down, du Plessis clips through midwicket, he wanted two but Maxwell raced in from long-on to deny them
Agar to Miller, 1 run flat on the stumps, Miller works one down the ground
Agar to du Plessis, 1 run pushed through on middle and leg, du Plessis backs away and slaps through cover point
Agar to Miller, no run floated up outside off stump, Miller picks out cover on the drive
Agar to Miller, 1 run full length, cracked back past the bowler, straight drive along the ground but not out of the middle and long-off keeps them to a single
Maxwell to Miller, FOUR runs drops a little short outside off and Miller crashes a Ming the Merciless cut through point
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run darted on the legs, swatted away through backward square
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up and du Plessis paddles one to backward square leg
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run flighted on the stumps, Miller tries to sweep hard but doesn't really get hold of it
Maxwell to du Plessis, 1 run du Plessis gives it the charge, launches Maxwell towards wide long-off, not going to reach the rope but it lands in front of the fielder
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run on the stumps, Miller is down early again to sweep one through backward square
Agar to Miller, 2 runs length ball, whipped through midwicket on the pull and they pick up two
Agar to Miller, FOUR runs ambles in and tosses it up on off stump, Miller clumps a drive down the ground, flat and hard through long-on for four
Agar to Miller, SIX runs goes a little short - and Miller goes big in response! Swipes a Popeye blow down the ground, forearms bulging as it sails over long-on
Agar to Miller, 2 runs dragged down and Miller cracks it wide of long-on, nearly another boundary but it's stopped a yard in front of the rope

Agar to Miller, SIX runs immense! Miller beats his chest like King Kong and then scrambles up the Empire State Building with Agar in his hand... Another breezy swing and the ball disappears into the crowd at long-on again!

Agar to Miller, OUT goes for another maximum but finds long-off! The bat skewed in the hands slightly, got under the shot and Maxwell positioned himself safely underneath to give Agar his maiden T20I wicket. Kong has been downed
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 leg bye back of a length, worked away off the legs
Hastings to Behardien, 1 run short ball, outside off, dragged through midwicket on the pull
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run angled in on the stumps, driven down the ground to long-on
Hastings to Behardien, 1 run back of a length in the channel, Behardien drops into the crease and steers through point
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run good length, whipped back through mid-on, dealing in singles at the moment
Hastings to Behardien, no run excellent finish to the over, Hastings gets it up in the blockhole and Behardien can only block it back to the bowler
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 wide gets this wrong, a slower ball but well wide of the tracks
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run pushed across the right-hander from over the wicket, du Plessis drives through the covers
Faulkner to Behardien, 1 run full and straight, can only dig it out down the ground - that's the SA 150
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length, no room to swing the arms, du Plessis can only shovel one to leg

Faulkner to Behardien, OUT hit out or get out... and Behardien is gone! It was a full toss, out the back of the hand, Behardien was at least trying to do some damage but he caught it off the toe of the bat and holed out to deep midwicket
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run length ball angled outside off, du Plessis steers it through cover point
Faulkner to Morris, 1 run another slower ball, Morris doesn't really get hold of it, in the air and bouncing down to long-on
Hazlewood to Morris, 1 run full and tailing towards leg stump as Morris backs away, can only chop it into the ground

Hazlewood to du Plessis, FOUR runs brings out the du-scoop! Faf finds the boundary, gets down low outside off stump and ramps a full delivery straight over the keeper and away... We've not seen much of that today
Hazlewood to du Plessis, FOUR runs back-to-back boundaries to the same part of the ground, this time via an inside edge! Made room to drive and picked up four more via a French cut - they all count
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run punched into the covers, that'll be fifty for du Plessis, his seventh in T20Is
Hazlewood to Morris, 1 wide shaping away as Morris stands and swings... called wide
Hazlewood to Morris, no run back of a length outside off, Morris slaps it to cover
Hazlewood to Morris, 1 run full length, 140kph just outside off, dug out for a quick single into the covers

Faulkner to Morris, OUT slogged into the deep and taken! Morris aims for the big boomer over extra cover but doesn't quite have the power required and Warner leaps to take it above his head... A standing slap from Morris, who fails to cash in this time
Faulkner to du Plessis, 2 runs full and wide, possibly a slower ball, du Plessis mistimes a drive, ballooning over cover but it's squarer than Morris' shot and lands between two fielders
Faulkner to du Plessis, SIX runs oh yes, he's nailed this one! Smoked back down the ground, hang time from du Plessis, the ball peppering the upper tiers again
Faulkner to du Plessis, 1 run full on the stumps and clubbed through midwicket
Faulkner to Wiese, 2 runs pitched up on the toes, flicked firmly off leg stump and Wiese hurtles back for a second

Faulkner to Wiese, 2 runs goes for the blockhole again, slightly leg side and Wiese bunts it in front of long-on for a couple - but those are pretty nifty figures from Faulkner, 3 for 28 from his allocation
Hastings to du Plessis, FOUR runs full and straight but somehow du Plessis has managed to hack it away for four through square leg
Hastings to du Plessis, SIX runs boshed! Hastings misses his length and du Plessis plants another on into the crowd, a mighty swing over cover
Hastings to du Plessis, SIX runs slower ball, on the stumps - and crashed over deep midwicket this time! A flat six to keep the good times rolling for the home fans
Hastings to du Plessis, FOUR runs lashed through point, this will be another boundary! Du Plessis opened up his stance and larruped a full ball flat and hard square
Hastings to du Plessis, OUT picks out deep midwicket! The fun is over for Faf! Full toss does the job for Hastings, this time du Plessis didn't quite get hold of it and he found the man in the deep

Hastings to Wiese, SIX runs yes they can, what a strike from Wiese! He puts this in the top tier with a straight drive down the ground, a Thor-like hammer blow to finish the innings and take South Africa to a handy-looking 204. Hastings wipes his brow, having conceded 26 off the over

4pm: South Africa will feel that's at very least a score that keeps them in it. The world record chase in T20s came at this ground and SA are nearly 30 runs short of the total that was overhauled by West Indies last year - but 200 is always a stiff ask, particularly for a side low on confidence. Faf du Plessis provided the ballast, allowing others to
Just a reminder what is chaseable on this ground.
Rababa will begin. He has a slip in...
Rabada to Finch, no run short of a length outside off, pulled straight to mid-on
Rabada to Finch, 2 runs banged in short again, this time Finch goes squarer with his pull, gets it over midwicket without perfectly timing it...comes off more top edge than middle
Rabada to Finch, no run fuller, on middle and off, straightens a touch on Finch and squares him up...the ball squirts into the off side
Rabada to Smith, 1 run now he's back to the short ball, Smith pulls it behind square
Rabada to Watson, no run full at off stump, Watson comes onto the front foot and defends
Morris to Smith, no run full outside off, hint of shape away from Smith who allows himself the luxury of a leave
Morris to Smith, FOUR runs fairly similar delivery, just a touch shorter outside off, Smith goes across the crease and pulls it through straight midwicket off the front foot
Morris to Smith, no run just short of midwicket! Another delivery banged in, Smith on the pull and he's beaten for pace, the ball comes off the handle and glove. Some pain for Smith
Morris to Smith, no run fuller outside off, a wild swing with his feet planted on leg stump...pretty much a slog
Morris to Smith, FOUR runs full and wide outside off, a much more controlled stroke this time as he drives it through the covers...not a million miles from the fielder, but placed well enough

Morris to Smith, 1 run width outside off, 147kph, Smith swings at it and gets a bottom edge wide of the stumps...smart piece of fielding from de Kock who collects and hits direct at the non-striker's end, but Smith is safe
Rabada to Smith, 1 run shuffles across the crease and flips a length delivery from outside off backward of square on the leg side
Rabada to Watson, no run angled into middle and leg, Watson doesn't make contact and it takes the pad to the leg side
Rabada to Watson, 1 run pushed onto the pads and flicked to long leg
Rabada to Smith, no run very short outside off, 146kph, and climbs over Smith's top edge as he has another wild swipe

Rabada to Smith, 1 run too quick for Smith, short outside off, and he tries to somehow get this to the leg side again and ends up with a thick outside edge down to third man with one hand off the bat. This isn't pretty from Smith
Rabada to Watson, no run full and straight, 145kph, Watson opens his stance a touch and crunches it straight to mid-off
Steyn to Smith, 1 leg bye starts with a straight delivery which Smith aims into the leg side, the ball trickles to square leg
Steyn to Watson, no run short of a length outside off, 134kph, cut firmly into the ground and it bounces to point...Watson will feel that was a boundary ball
Steyn to Watson, no run he moves to the leg side against this shorter delivery and pulls to midwicket inside the circle
Steyn to Watson, no run fuller, this follows Watson as he moves outside leg, 133kph, and thunders into the pads

Steyn to Watson, FOUR runs connects well enough this time to beat mid-on, short outside off stump and Watson fetches it with the pull...still not ideally timed, but it's wide of the diving mid-on and beats deep midwicket

Steyn to Watson, no run moving outside leg stump again, Steyn follows him and it comes out as a full toss...Watson jabs it, rather alarmed, into the off side. Questions whether it should have been a no-ball. Looked just okay.

Rabada to Smith, 1 wide appeal for a catch down the leg side, but it's called a wide...Smith moving around his crease, goes to help this off his hip. There was a noise and the ball wasn't near the pad. The replay suggests it was glove
Rabada to Smith, no run pushed into the off side
Rabada to Smith, SIX runs gets this one cleanly, it was a fuller ball and Smith was able to get underneath it with a (relatively) straight bat and lofts it over mid-on
Rabada to Smith, 1 run back of a length, crunched towards square leg with another cross-batted swat...square leg can't stop it cleanly, Steyn tidies up in the deep
Rabada to Watson, no run swing and a miss as he moves outside leg stump then swings to the on side, the ball scoots past his inside edge and pads
Rabada to Watson, no run much fuller, on middle and leg, takes a thick outside edge into the covers as he aims into midwicket
Rabada to Watson, no run a bouncer, angled over leg stump, travels over the gloves and he escapes a wide call

Steyn to Smith, OUT oh, my goodness! What a catch by Rabada at third man. This is stunning and will take be a moment to explain. It was a short-of-a-length delivery outside off, Smith throws the kitchen sink at it and a top edge flies towards third man. Rabada started by running in and actually came too far. He realised, then just thrust up his
Steyn to Watson, no run beaten and tries to play this delivery into the off side, just a hint of swing
Steyn to Watson, FOUR runs width outside off, he goes for the upper cut and gets it wide of third man (even KG isn't reaching it)

Steyn to Watson, OUT another terrific catch! They are holding everything at the moment. Duminy running back from point this time. Short outside off, Watson having another full-blown swing at it. The ball doesn't have the distance this time, but Duminy still did superbly to take it over his shoulder. Would also have had Rabada in the corner of h
Steyn to Warner, no run lovely bowling...full outside off, Warner's feet not quite moving yet, the ball shapes in a touch the holds its line to beat the drive
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs short of a length on the hip and he gets it away fine with a neat tuck past short fine leg
Morris to Maxwell, 1 wide shoved down the leg side, called wide
Morris to Maxwell, 1 run angled down to third man from outside off
Morris to Warner, 1 run short of a length, Warner pulls to deep square leg
Morris to Maxwell, 1 run tucks a length delivery gently into square leg...Australia just trying to settle for a few moments
Morris to Warner, FOUR runs this time there's more power and he has the placement, short from Morris and it sits up for the pull which is well controlled backward of square
Morris to Warner, no run gets the line outside off, still short of a length, chopped to backward point
Morris to Warner, 1 run slower ball, full outside off, driven into the covers
Wiese to Warner, 1 run full at off stump, opens the face and drives to deep point
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs nicely played, moving across to off stump and whips a straight delivery off his pads wide of short fine leg
Wiese to Maxwell, 2 runs back outside off stump, Maxwell drives and it comes off the toe of the bat towards third man
Wiese to Maxwell, 2 runs slashes again at some width outside off, Morris gets more work at third man and can't stop the second
Wiese to Maxwell, SIX runs top shot! The best of Maxwell. Holds his shape and drives on the up through the line of a length delivery outside off and sends it over long off
Wiese to Maxwell, no run good response from Wiese as he gets this one past Maxwell's outside edge as he drives
Tahir to Warner, 1 run tucks a straight delivery into midwicket
Tahir to Maxwell, 2 runs goes for the reverse sweep to a straight full toss and gets it fine of short third man
Tahir to Maxwell, no run on off stump, tight line, pushed to cover
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run worked into the leg side
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs that's pumped over deep midwicket...fetched from full outside off, down on his back knee, with the slog sweep. Good connection
Tahir to Warner, 1 run cut to deep cover
Wiese to Warner, 1 run back of a length, driven to deep cover
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs that slips out as a big full toss, gets heaved to deep square where there's bad misfield by Tahir which gifts a boundary...didn't quite anticipate the spin on the ball
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs heaves a length delivery through straight midwicket, a skimming shot from Maxwell which bisects deep midwicket and long on
Wiese to Maxwell, 1 run another low full toss, straighter this time, swung to long on
Wiese to Warner, SIX runs short outside off and handsomely put away over deep midwicket with a strong-armed pull...a dragged down slower ball, so basically a long hop
Wiese to Warner, 1 run drives a full delivery into the covers
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs flayed over the off side, a hint of width to Warner who throws his hands through the drive and sends it over cover
Tahir to Warner, no run touch shorter this time, Warner angry with himself as he finds cover inside the circle
Tahir to Warner, 1 run comes forward and drives to the cover sweeper
Tahir to Maxwell, 2 runs flicks a straight delivery through midwicket
Tahir to Maxwell, no run can't get this one away, nudges into the leg side
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run stays back in the crease and flicks it carefully into midwicket
Wiese to Maxwell, no run full outside off, on the popping crease, squeezed to backward point
Wiese to Maxwell, 1 run low full toss outside off, driven to cover
Wiese to Warner, 2 runs full and straight, another low full toss, flicked through midwicket, good work in the deep...Wiese now trying to keep the ball full
Wiese to Warner, 1 run some width outside off which is driven to long off
Wiese to Maxwell, no run tries to reverse sweep a wide delivery outside off, defeated by the slower delivery
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs so he opts for something more conventional and it's more productive...pumps a full delivery straight down the ground. Stand and deliver.
Tahir to Warner, 1 run short outside off, Warner onto the back foot and drags it to deep midwicket
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 wide he saw Maxwell starting to move and fired this down the leg side
Tahir to Maxwell, no run nearly cleans him up with a short ball which scoots through a touch low and defeats Maxwell's pull
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run flicked to deep midwicket
Tahir to Warner, no run full outside off, Warner aiming to deep midwicket with a slog sweep but gets an inside edge into his back leg
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs that's just brute force, hammers it straight down the ground...wasn't quite so full, and it didn't even come out of the middle but comfortably split the deep fielders
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs this flies off the top edge as he swings across the line and goes fine of short third man

Wiese to Maxwell, SIX runs and he gets launched into the stands over long on...Maxwell swings at a full delivery, a slower ball, outside off and even though it comes off close to the bottom of the bat it has the legs
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs that's just a little bit bonkers, but then it's Maxwell after all...reverse ramp or scoop at a low full toss which he gets almost over the keeper's head
Wiese to Maxwell, no run goes for another reverse hit and this time doesn't make contact
Wiese to Maxwell, SIX runs that's a big full and it's out of the ground! Swung over deep square leg. Horrid delivery, really. And that's his fifty off 26 deliveries
Wiese to Maxwell, 1 wide comes round the wicket, pushed across wide outside off and he doesn't get away with that
Wiese to Maxwell, 1 run that's better, a yorker just outside off, jabbed into the off side...a mundane single
Wiese to Warner, no run back over he wicket, Warner swings himself off his feet as he tries to catch up with a delivery angled wide across him...not far from a wide, but the umpire lets it go
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run cut firmly into the covers, straight to du Plessis but still a single which brings up the hundred stand off 44 balls
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs full toss. Dispatched. Slog sweep. Deep midwicket. Rinse and repeat
Tahir to Warner, FOUR runs that's brilliant from Warner, this ball pitches quite wide outside off but he's able to drag it straight of long on...skims over the outfield. That's his fifty
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs over deep midwicket again! There were cries of 'catch it' and it didn't have huge elevation, but just had the height to beat Morris near the rope
Tahir to Warner, 1 run down on his back knee with another slog sweep and this time it's straight to deep midwicket
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run a moment of relative calm as he tucks a single through midwicket
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 run length ball outside off, opens the face and dabbed into the covers
Steyn to Warner, SIX runs it doesn't matter who you are, you are being launched into the stands...this is short of a length and Warner plays a terrific pick-up pull over deep square leg
Steyn to Warner, 1 run that comes out as a low full toss, Warner swings hard, his bottom hand comes off the bat as he finds long on
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 run crunched into the off side, can't beat the circle
Steyn to Warner, 1 run well bowled, but Warner is still able to dig it out straight down the ground, was full at leg stump
Steyn to Maxwell, no run beats him outside off, the ball scoots past the outside edge as Maxwell drives...a precious dot ball
Morris to Warner, 1 run round the wicket, full outside off, swung to deep midwicket
Morris to Maxwell, 1 run that's well bowled, full at off stump, squirted into the off side
Morris to Warner, FOUR runs charges down the pitch, it was already a full toss, that's crunched straight down the ground...at the boundary almost before you can blink
Morris to Warner, no run responds well with a yorker at middle stump, takes an inside into his boot...can't get the single
Morris to Warner, 1 run whipped strongly along the ground through midwicket
Morris to Maxwell, (no ball) FOUR runs and it's a filthy full toss, Maxwell swings with his full force and it takes a top edge to third man...and it's a no-ball! Oh dear.
Morris to Maxwell, 1 wide full, angled down the leg side, it's a wide so the free hit carries over...and the over has gone very pear-shaped
Morris to Maxwell, 1 wide now it's wide outside off! Maxwell moving around his crease, Morris trying to out think him but it's too wide
Morris to Maxwell, 2 runs manages to get this full and straight, was still a free hit, clubbed towards long-on and the pace of this pair between the wickets makes it into a brace
Steyn to Warner, 1 leg bye full, straight, hint of swing...Warner misses his whip to the leg side and the ball cannons off his pads to the covers
Steyn to Maxwell, 2 runs backs away to leg against a length delivery, driven through mid-off where du Plessis dives and gets a hand on it...comes up holding his shoulder
Steyn to Maxwell, 2 runs another big full toss, sliced away off a thick outer part of the bat down to third man
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 run full outside off, driven straight to point. They scamper the run and there's no throw due to a lack of backing up
Steyn to Warner, 1 run another full toss, and just over cover! Warner slicing his drive, du Plessis leapt at cover on the edge of the circle
Steyn to Maxwell, (no ball) 1 run he just can't pitch it at the moment, that's a big full toss and called a no-ball this time...swung into the on side
Steyn to Warner, 2 runs tries to be inventive, effectively sweeps a delivery from full outside off along the ground through midwicket and more excellent running from this pair
Morris to Maxwell, no run short of a length, swing and a miss! Dot ball
Morris to Maxwell, 1 leg bye full, angled into the pads, he doesn't make contact and it's just a leg bye towards midwicket. The tension mounts
Morris to Warner, 1 run comes round the wicket, aiming full at the stumps, Warner smears it straight to long on
Morris to Maxwell, FOUR runs oh, Maxwell! We've seen it so many times, but it's still brilliant. Under pressure he was reverse swept a full delivery outside off fine of short third man

Morris to Warner, 1 leg bye it's all happening! It's well bowled, speared in at the pads, deflects straight back Morris but Warner just wants the strike. Marsh had no chance, but Morris then under-arms the ball wide of the stumps from about six yards away! Don't take him ten-pin bowling tonight
Rabada to Faulkner, 1 wide wide outside off, and called wide! Rabada trying to keep it full but gets the line wrong
Rabada to Faulkner, 2 runs gets a length delivery and launches it straight down the ground, long on comes around and then flicks the ball to long off to throw in

Rabada to Faulkner, 1 wide swing and a miss! Called wide again! That seems a harsh call. Looked inside the white guideline to me. Actually, on the replay, that was over the white guideline, so fair call from the umpire
Rabada to Faulkner, 2 runs gets this full and straight, driven through the covers to the sweeper and they can't cut off the second...wasn't a very good return from the deep

Rabada to Faulkner, 2 runs it's a good ball, full at the stumps, but he gets it straight down the ground...bisects long on and long off, then the return from the deep has very little power on the throw. Marsh was struggling to make his ground, the ball took an age to get back from the deep. Goes to the third umpire but he's just safe. A costly
Rabada to Faulkner, 1 run swings to leg against a length ball, gets an inside edge into his pads and it runs into the off side

Rabada to Marsh, 2 runs he bunts it straight down the ground and Australia win! It was a good delivery, full and straight, but Marsh managed to hit it into the pitch, past Rababa and neither long off or long on could stop the second.

Phew, what a game. Australia win by five wickets, to end a run of five defeats. And it was a superb chase of a big total, even more so after that early problems when they were three down. Warner and Maxwell added 161 for the fourth wicket before their dismissals gave South Africa hope at the very end. Some of the home side's bowling, though, struggle
Australia won by 5 wickets
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
